comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: This does not look like a Triplane but like an 'ordinary' Biplane

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: This is the first machine built by the Catron & Fisk Airplane & Engine Company from California, Ocean Park. The man behind the firm were J.W. Catron and Edward M. Fisk. This biplane dates from 1919 and was a sport model fitted with an OX-5 engine of 90 hp, where the radiator was characteristically positioned just in front of the pilot. Two sets of wings were provided, one set for the single seat sport type and another for a two-seat utility type. Span of the sporting type was 18 feet, while the two-seater had a span of 29 feet. Maximum speed of the sport model is 130 miles / hour (not bad for the times !). Only one machine was built, but commercially a failure with all the war surplus machines available at break down prices Catron & Fisk persevered on for a few years, building several types, quite a lot of them being triplanes.
